Treatment includes rest, icing, NSAIDs and even oral corticosteroids (30 mg per day) for a short course of 3 to 5 days. Local cortisone injections are effective, but should be used as a second-line treatment, as spontaneous favourable evolution is the rule.

question.title: What is the typical duration of treatment for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals?

option_a.title: A short course of 3 to 5 days
option_a.description: The typical duration of treatment for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals

option_b.title: A short course of 1 to 3 days
option_b.description: The typical duration of treatment for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals

option_c.title: A short course of 5 to 7 days
option_c.description: The typical duration of treatment for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals

option_d.title: A short course of 1 to 2 weeks
option_d.description: The typical duration of treatment for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals

correct_option.title: A short course of 3 to 5 days
